Reviews.Content: It's not fancy but it's fine for the price       bath
Reviews.Author: thebeerhunter

Reviews.Content: Disgraceful hotel. I have stayed here a few times (not through choice as the company put us here) and it is without a doubt the worst hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in and I have been all over the world and stayed in some pretty bad places.The staff are incompetent and do not care at all about the customers, the rooms are disgusting, old and not cleaned well. A friend had a remote control made into his bed and mine had damp sheets with cigarette burns in it.There is a train that passes through the night and blares it's horn, very annoying. I could go on and on but I just want to warn you that this place is disgusting and should be avoided at all costs. We complained so much our company has abandoned this hotel for good.
Reviews.Author: gymshark

Reviews.Content: Don't arrive on an early flight and try to stay here We arrived at 2.45 pm and were told we had to wait until 3:00 pm for our room to be cleaned; the clerk pointed to the 3pm checkin sign. (Most airport hotels accommodate early arriving travelers...that's the nature of the location). By 3:15 we were finally allowed to register (the delay being, they said, due to room being cleaned.) When we went to the room there was a whole row of similar rooms all ready with open windows, no cleaning cart in sight, and inside no sign of recent cleaning such as a wet tub or sink. (Yes, no interior corridors, makes one wonder about security). In addition we asked for a quiet room and were given a room right behind the restaurant with its groaning a/c system. No wonder this BW wants a previous day cancellation ... once on site and treated like this we would have cancelled on the spot.
Reviews.Author: Bulgarian

Reviews.Content: horrible place to stay 1. Guest was absolutely not allowed to check in before 3pm even though a room was ready.2. A king room was reserved but double was assigned.3. Mold or some kind of discoloration on the ceiling of the room.4. Reception not friendly at all.Do yourself a favor and avoid this place despite its convenient location to the airport.
Reviews.Author: TheExecutive

Reviews.Content: Billed me twice, horrible room Place looked nice on its web pics. Thought it would be convenient but it turned out to be anything but. When I called for directions they gave me the wrong info, when I arrived the guy at the check-in desk was out for dinner and I was told by another hotel employee to just wait like 20 minutes standing around was something they do to every guest. The facility itself is in terrible shape and when I got home I discovered that they had charged me for two nights instead of one. Up until now I'd never had a bad night at a Best Western.
Reviews.Author: blxhans

Reviews.Content: Scary!! My mother and I stayed here for one night before we moved on to another hotel in New Orleans. Our plane arrived at 12:30am. The personnel were pleasant and had no problems with our late check-in. But when we arrived at the airport and called them to pick us up, the lady answering the phone mumbled so much I couldn't understand her. We waited and waited and finally were told by a taxi driver to catch the hotel's shuttle in the transportation area (different than where the cabs pick up). The shuttle driver was pleasant though. The concierge was also pleasant on check-in but for two women travelling alone - they could have put us in a safer room! We were put all the way around the back side of the hotel up on the 4th floor. We had to walk through two dark alley ways and wait in a dark elevator shaft area. Once settled in, we got to listen to a drug deal on the balcony outside our room - we barracaded the door with the table and chair! We also got to listen to a horn-happy train several times that night - it was like something out of that movie My Cousin Vinny! The rooms were okay, but they were old and dirty looking. They have a sign in the lobby that says Please excuse our dust, we are still recovering from Hurricane Katrina - 19 months later at the airport? Sounds like an excuse to lighten the housekeeping chores. If you stay here - ask for a room close to the lobby. Also, the cab they called to take us to New Orleans took Airport Hwy instead of Hwy 10 - taking longer and costing more! Be sure to tell them to take Hwy 10.
Reviews.Author: Lovethatcity

Reviews.Content: Worst hotel of my vacation This is the worst Best Western I've ever stayed. The bathroom door would not close all the way. It may have been swollen due to humidity. I don't know. I just know it would not fit into the door frame to close. Both bedspreads were stained on the white underside. I couldn't tell if the colored outside was stained. But the whole room seemed very dirty. The writing table was sticky. The writing chairs were rickety and will probably soon collapse. We were on the third floor, and the ice machine was on the first floor. It did not work. I had to go to another wing's ice machine. The location is great, though. Right across the street from the airport.
Reviews.Author: G8R

Reviews.Content: Get some educated help I haven't even stayed there yet  already problems. When inquiring about a room  services, I could not even understand the mumblings of the person who answered the phone. She was not helpful,  worse than that, she became irritated with every question I asked. She put me on hold, and after 7 minutes, I hung up.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: I had no problems Location immediately across from MSY (less than 100 yards). No major problems with plane noise...my room was located a bit away from the airport. Denny's on property. Both hotel/restaurant kept up decently. I checked in early....they had a room for me. They said they'd have a better one if I waited for an hour that Saturday morning [October 30]. I ate lunch....they had the better room. Room/service was typical chain hotel. But that's what I paid for. So that's what I expected. No problems.
Reviews.Author: jleq

Reviews.Content: overbooked I had reserved a room here last week for some guests flying in for a wedding. I guaranteed payment with a credit card, and called that day and re-confirmed. When I arrived with my guests I learned that, alas, they had no more rooms. I was told they would provide free accommodation at a comparable establishment, but as I stood there and waited while the clerk called around it became obvious that no such accomodation was to be found anywhere nearby at the late hour of 11:30 pm. So, I took my guests to my house, gave them my bed, and slept on the floor. I was not the only person with a confirmed and guaranteed reservation there who found no room that night.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: average but noisy Date of stay: Jan 13, 2004 Hotel location: practically in airport's parking lot Room location: 3rd floor, facing pool and airport parking lot Overall hotel appearance: average Quality of room: average. However, because the room faces the airport parking lot, you can really hear the airplanes that fly overhead, esp in the still of the night. Also, road traffic didn't die down till about 1 a.m. The night of my stay, I turned on the heater because it was in the mid-40s. It was hard to regulate the heat, and the room warmed up too quickly and gave out a sharp odor which lasted a long time. This probably wouldn't be a problem if your stay takes place when the weather is much warmer. Quality of bathroom: average Quality of staff: average Security: average for both hotel and room Meals: Denny's is right next door. Service at Denny's was horrible because of 2 new staff in training -- I had to wait about 2 hrs before my dinner arrived. Recommendation: ok if you're on a budget, but if you want to get some sleep, try another hotel about 1 - 2 mi further from airport
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here! My family and I stayed at the Best Western New Orleans Inn At the Airport from Nov 17-20 as it was close to the venue for a conference we were attending in Destrehan. The hotel is located just across the MSY airport and the hotel provided complimentary transport to and from the airport. Being a budget hotel, it was nothing fancy but well-appointed with all the necessary amenities including a gym and a swimming pool. Too bad it wasn't a heated one but the hotel never claimed on its website that it was heated so we could accept that. The room we stayed in was really nice and clean and the bathroom was brightly lit. Adjoining the hotel is Denny's and it was really convenient for our meals. The hotel serves complimentary continental breakfast in Denny's. I find that I enjoyed my stay here more than my stay at Sheraton New Orleans where we stayed in from Nov 20-24. (Refer to my review on Sheraton). After the conference was over, we thought of staying closer to the French Quarter so we moved to Sheraton for the rest of our stay in New Orleans. On hindsight, I found that I was more satisfied with my stay in BW. My family and I had a really good and enjoyable time in New Orleans. We would love to come back. And we'll definitely stay at BW N. Orleans Inn at the Airport again should we need to attend any future conferences in Destrehan.
Reviews.Author: covenantman
